headline.main: VIEWS FROM WASHINGTON.; Trade Reviving and Why--Washington Benefited by the War--Our Relations with Spain.

docs.lead_paragraph: The whole country is beginning to feel the invigorating influence of the immense expenditures of the Government in reviving languishing trade. The effects of panic, which the various departments of business suffered when the rebellion broke out, have passed away. The worst has come.

docs.snippet: SUSPECTED SECESSIONISTS ARRESTED AND DISCHARGED. There was much excttement in the Park, yesterday afternoon, in consequence of the arrest of an alleged Secessionist. The man had been talking disrespectfully of the Administration, while in a drinking...
docs.lead_paragraph: SUSPECTED SECESSIONISTS ARRESTED AND DISCHARGED. There was much excttement in the Park, yesterday afternoon, in consequence of the arrest of an alleged Secessionist. The man had been talking disrespectfully of the Administration, while in a drinking saloon on Broadway, opposite the Park, and his sentiments not meeting with approbation, it was determined to take him before the Mayor.

docs.snippet: The Academy of Music will open for the season to-night, but not with opera. For the moment the musical prospect is somewhat clouded. There is a vague rumor, to be sure, that there will be a Winter season of opera, but in the absence of singers, both...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Academy of Music will open for the season to-night, but not with opera. For the moment the musical prospect is somewhat clouded. There is a vague rumor, to be sure, that there will be a Winter season of opera, but in the absence of singers, both male and female, we can hardly hope that it is of any significance.

headline.main: IMPORTANT FROM MONROE.; The Rebel Privateer Yorktown Undertakes to Run the Blockade Shots Exchanged Nobody Hurt Rebels Near Newport's News Arrival of Political Prisoners. PIRATES ON THE EQUATOR. FROM BUENOS AYRES AFFAIRS IN THE CONFEDERATION PIRATES CRUISING ON THE EQUATOR THE CAPTURE BY THE CUMBERLAND. ARMY AND NAVY INTELLIGENCE. AFFAIRS IN BALTIMORE. CAUGHT AT LAST.

docs.lead_paragraph: There was a prospect of an engagement last night at Newport's News. About 4 P.M. the steamer Yorktown ran down to within three miles, and opened fire upon the camp and blockading squadron, consisting of tile Savannah, Cumberland, and the gun-boat Louisiana.

headline.main: NOTES OF THE REBELLION.; CALAMITOUS CONDITION OF MISSOURI. AFFAIRS IN EAST TENNESSEE. TREASON DEFINED IN WESTERN VIRGINIA A LETTER OF GOV. PIERPONT. THE COMMONWEALTH OF VIRGINIA, EXECUTIVE DEPARTMENT WHEELING, Sept. 2, 1861. BRIG.-GEN. FLOYD. WHAT FLOYD DID AND WHAT HE DIDN'T. WAYNE COURT-HOUSE TAKEN. THE PRIVATEER SUMTER. LETTER FROM THE CAPTAIN AND CREW. CRUISE OF THE PRIVATEER DIXIE. HISTORY OF HER EXPLOITS ON THE HIGH SEAS. THE PRISONERS AT RICHMOND. EXPERIENCES OF A CAPTURED OFFICER. AFFAIRS IN VIRGINIA. THE FORMATION OF PARTIES IN VIRGINIA. NEWS FROM FREDERICKSBURGH, VA. SICKNESS IN THE REBEL CAMP. SEQUESTRATION OF NORTHERN PROPERTY IN THE SOUTH. STATE OF AFFAIRS IN THE NORTH FROM A SOUTHERN STAND POINT. PLAIN COUNSEL. A TOUCHING APPEAL FOR THE REBELS. The Memphis Appeal publishes the following pathetic document, which is indorsed by THOMAS C. REYNOLDS, formerly Lieutenant-Governor of Missouri: FROM GEORGIA. MORE REBEL PRISONERS ON PAROLE. KENTUCKY. THE NEUTRALITY OF KENTUCKY. INTERCEPTED CONFEDERATE LETTERS. LETTER FROM SECRET
